THE  LAWS  LOCAL  EXTENT  ACT,  1874  
 
1Act No. XV OF 1874  
 
[8th December,  1874]  
 
An Act for declaring  the local  extent of certain  Enactments,  and for other  purposes  
 
 Preamble.  WHEREAS  it is expedient  to declare  the local  extent  of certain  Acts passed  by the 
Governor  General  of India  in Council,  the Legislative  Council  of India,  and the Council  of the 
Governor  General  of India  assembled  for the purpose  of making  Laws  and Regulations;  
 
 AND  WHEREAS  it is also expedient  to consolidate  the laws relating to the local  extent  of 
certain  Acts and Regulations  2* * *; 
 
 It is hereby  declared  and enacted  as follows:__ 
 
 1. Short title.  This Act may be called  the Laws  Local  Extent  Act, 1874.  
 
 2. Interpretation -clause.  In this Act the expression  “Scheduled  Districts”  means  the 
territories  mentioned  in the sixth  schedule  hereto  annexed.  
 
 3. Local  extent  of Acts  in first schedule . The Acts mentioned  in the first schedule  hereto  
annexed  are now in force  throughout  3[Pakistan],  except  the Scheduled  Districts.  
 
 4. [Local  extent  of enactments  in second  schedule .] Omitted  by A.O.,  1949,  Sch. 
 
 5. [Local  extent  of enactments  in third  schedule. ] Omitted  by A. O., 1949,  Sch. 
 
 46. [Local  extent  of enactments  in fourth  schedule. ] Omitted  by the Federal  Laws  (Revision  
and Declaration)  Ordinance,  1981  (XXVII  of 1981),  s. 3 and IInd Sch. 
 
 7. [Local  extent  of enactments  in fifth schedule. ] Omitted by A. O., 1949,  Sch 
 
 8. Savings. Nothing herein contained shall___ 
 
(a)  bar the power of the 5[Federal Government] or the 6[Provincial Government], 
under any law for the time being in force, to extend to any place any Act men -
tioned in the said fi rst schedule;  
 
(b)  extend any Act empowering the 6[Provincial Govern ment] to extend the same 
or any part thereof, or affect in any manner the exercise of such power;  
 
(c)  affect the operation of any Act or Regulation heretofore extended to or 
declared t o be in force in any of the Scheduled Districts;  
 
1For the Statement  of Objects  and Reasons,  see Gazette  of India,  1870  Pt. V., p. 153; and for Proceedings  in Council,  see ibid.,  1871,   Supplement  pp. 
1074  and 1218;  and ibid.,  1874  Supplement,  pp. 1885  and 1976.  
This Act has been  extended  and shall be deemed  to have  been  so extended  to the whole  of Pakistan  by the Central  Laws  (Statute  Reform)  Ordinance  
1960  (21 of 1960),  s. 3 and 2nd Sch. (with effect  from  the 14th October,  1955 ) 
2The words  “in the Preside ncies  of Fort St. George  and Bombay,  and in the Lower  and the North -Western  Provinces  of the Presidency   of  Fort William  
in Bengal”  omitted  by A. O., 1949,  Sch. 
3Subs.  by the Central  Laws  (Statute  Reform)  Ordinance,  1960  (21 of 1960),  s. 3 and 2nd Sch. (with effect  from the 14th October,  1955 ) for “all the 
Provinces  and the Capital  of the Federation”  which  had been  subs.  by A. O., 1949,  Arts 3 (2) and 4, for the whole  of British  India”.  
4This section  was previously  amended  by Ord. 21 of 1960.  s. 3 and 2nd Sch. and A.O.,  1961,  Art. 2 (w.e.f.  23-3-1956).  
5Subs. by F.A.O., 1975, Art. 2 and Table, for “Central Government” which was subs. by A.O., 1937, for “G, G. in C.”,  
6Subs. ibid., for “L. G.”  
 
 
Page 3 of 4 
 (d)  revive  any enactment  which  has been  repealed  either  general ly or with 
reference  to some  special  subject;  
 
1*           *           *          *          *           * 
 
(k)  affect  the operation  of any enactment  not mentioned  in any of the schedules  
hereto  annexed.  
 
 9. [Enactments  repealed .] Rep. by the Repealing  Act,1876  (XII of 1876).  
 
2[FIRST  SCHEDULE  
[See section  3]

1850,  XVIII .. Protection  of Judicial  Officers.  
1850,  XXI .. Non-forfeiture  of rights  by loss of caste.  
1855,XI  .. Mesne  profits  and improvements.

death.  caused  by actionable  wrong.

1860,  XXI .. Registration  of Societies.  
1863,  XVI .. Excise  Duty  payable  on Spirits  used in Arts 
and Manufactures.  
1865,  III .. Common  Carries.]  
 
 SECOND SCHEDULE .__[(a)__ Madras Regulations and (b)__ Acts of the Supreme Council  
relating to the Madras Presidency. ] Omitted by A.O., 1949, Schedule.  
 
 THIRD SCHEDULE .__[(a)__ Bombay Regulations and (b)__Acts of the Supreme Council  
relating to the Bombay Presidency. ] Omitte d by A.O., 1949, Schedule.  
____  
 FOURTH SCHEDULE .__[(a)__Bengal Regulations Lower Pro vinces and (b). -Acts of the 
SupremeCouncil relating to the Lower Pro vinces. ] Omitted by the Federal Laws (Revision and 
Declaration) Ordi nance. 1981 (XXVII of 1981), s. 3 and IInd Sch.  
 
 FIFTH SCHEDULE .__[(a)__.Bengal Regulations (North -Western Provinces) and (b)__Acts of 
theSupreme Council relating to the North -Western Provinces. ] Omitted by A.O., 1949., Schedule.  
 
1Cls. (e) and (h) were.  rep. by Act 8 of 1887,  cl. (f) by the Amending  Act, 1891  (12 of 1891),  cl. (g) by the Guardians  and Wards  Act, 1890  (8 of 1890),  
and cl. (i) by the Repealing  and Amending  Act, 1894  (4 of 1894)  and cIs. (j) and (jj) by A. O. 1949,  Sch. Cl. (jj) had been  ins. by the Benares  Family  
Domains  Act, 1881  (14 of 1881),  s. 15. 
2First Schedule  previously  amended  by various  laws from  time to time has been  subs.  by the Federal  Laws  (Revision  and Declaration)   Ordinance,  1981  
(27 of 1981),  s. 3 and 2nd Sch.,  to read as above.

The Whole  of Sindh.]
